nodes.text: The Grapnel-harpoon launcher was a handheld grapnel launcher produced by the weapons division of Pharr Co.

Produced with the targeting capabilities and balance to be used effectively in the middle of combat, the grapnel-harpoon launcher made use of a magnetic firing mechanism to launch a grappling hook and line with enough force and precision to be classified as a light weapon.

In addition to using its high-powered hook and internal winch as a standard climbing tool, the grapnel-harpoon was also especially suited to snaring and entangling opponents in the launcher's high-tensile cord, and was often often used by thieves and bounty hunters who didn't want their victims to fight back.
